questions.text: Have I rejoiced in the success and holiness of brother priests?
Have I shown compassion to the suffering without judgment?
Have I spoken charitably about others, especially parishioners?
Have I served the poor and marginalized with genuine love?
Have I acted out of love rather than obligation?
Have I avoided feelings of envy when comparing my ministry?
Have I encouraged vocations generously without pride?
Have I welcomed others’ gifts in the Church with humility?
Have I loved the flock entrusted to me with tenderness?
Have I asked the Lord to increase true charity in my heart?
Have I prepared well for homilies, sacraments, and duties?
Have I avoided spiritual laziness in prayer or formation?
Have I been available to the faithful when needed?
Have I made time for the sick, elderly, or those in need?
Have I been faithful to daily responsibilities and obligations?
Have I avoided distractions during office hours or pastoral work?
Have I shown consistency in prayer and the Liturgy of the Hours?
Have I pursued excellence in my ministry for the glory of God?
Have I been attentive in confessions and spiritual direction?
Have I asked the Holy Spirit to energize my priestly zeal?
Have I maintained custody of the eyes and purity of thoughts?
Have I entertained impure thoughts or used inappropriate media?
Have I kept appropriate boundaries with others?
Have I respected celibacy with a joyful and free heart?
Have I spoken about chastity as a gift, not a burden?
Have I modeled holy friendship rooted in Christ?
Have I avoided situations that invite temptation?
Have I confessed and repented quickly when I’ve failed?
Have I prayed for purity and grace in daily life?
Have I sought spiritual support and accountability?
Have I responded to conflict calmly and with prayer?
Have I shown patience with staff, volunteers, and parishioners?
Have I been forgiving when criticized or disrespected?
Have I corrected others with love, not anger?
Have I handled setbacks or misunderstandings prayerfully?
Have I avoided gossip or harsh judgment when wronged?
Have I prayed for difficult people in my care?
Have I trusted God’s timing over my own frustration?
Have I modeled calm leadership under pressure?
Have I asked forgiveness when I acted in anger?
Have I lived simply and detached from materialism?
Have I been generous with my time, attention, and presence?
Have I avoided comfort-seeking that hinders my ministry?
Have I served others joyfully without counting the cost?
Have I shared my blessings with the poor or overlooked?
Have I welcomed others into the Church with warmth?
Have I used Church resources responsibly and humbly?
Have I offered spiritual help without expecting thanks?
Have I treated those with less influence with equal dignity?
Have I shown that kindness flows from Christ’s love in me?
Have I used food, drink, or leisure in moderation?
Have I modeled temperance in speech and habits?
Have I avoided excess in entertainment, rest, or technology?
Have I practiced fasting and mortification with devotion?
Have I resisted indulgence in comforts that distract from God?
Have I helped others grow in temperance by example?
Have I honored Sundays and days of fasting well?
Have I been intentional with how I spend time and money?
Have I offered sacrifice for the people I serve?
Have I embraced simplicity as a witness to the Gospel?
Have I boasted about my ministry or accomplishments?
Have I served quietly without seeking praise or control?
Have I submitted to Church authority with trust?
Have I welcomed fraternal correction with openness?
Have I given glory to God for all good I have done?
Have I avoided clericalism and sought to be a servant?
Have I admitted my limits and asked for help?
Have I placed others' needs before my preferences?
Have I listened with the heart of Christ the Good Shepherd?
Have I prayed daily for humility and holiness?
